fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition

When viewing a single Jira issue, it is not clear which repository a given pull request, commit, or branch belongs to. If I am looking at a group of issues, it is difficult to determine which repositories are related to these issues in Jira.
h3. Suggested Solution

Add the ability to filter Jira issues based on code repository in a linked DVCS account, Bitbucket application link, etc. This will enable admins to create boards specific to relevant repositories.
h3. Why this is important

As a software developer, I often need to ensure with 100% certainty that the issue I am looking at in Jira is related to a specific code repo. This will help my team find the issues they care about more quickly and eliminate mistakes.
fields.summary: Display relevant repositories in issue dev panel

project.name: Jira Software Server and Data Center

fields.description:
We have multiple teams working on the same project (shared backlog and epics) within the same sprint. Current Jira does not allows us to have a joined sprint while still having metrics on a team level. NextGen projects look promising, but are not supporting teams as entities nor do they support multiple simultaneous sprints. We would like the ability to:
 * create teams (group Jira users to a team)
 * assign stories, tasks etc to teams 
 * have more teams working on the same epic
 * start one sprint with multiple teams contributing to the sprint
 * have team level and multi-team level velocity, burn-down charts etc.
fields.summary: Add Teams to NextGen projects

fields.description:
Previously, AMD users could copy link text in issue filter detail list views. Now, AMD users report that this is no longer possible as the Issues are movable objects when selected.

*Steps to reproduce the issue*
 # Login to a Jira Instance as a regular user (or admin really)
 # Navigate to any issue filter in detail view.
 # Example URL here: [http://myjira.domain.com/issues/?filter=10091]
 # Click on any issue in the List
 # The issue text cannot be copied and pasted: For example, to copy the key & summary into an email or document. Previously, users were able to copy & paste.
 # Expected behaviour: Users able to select text & copy like from normal web pages 
 # Actual behaviour: Issue selects and “moves as a dynamic element” on the page. 
 # Client states that copy & paste work in Internet Explorer, but not Chrome or Firefox. 
 # Testing did not show any working copy & paste for browsers in reporter's testing
fields.summary: Users cannot copy text from Issue Filters in Jira

fields.description:
h3. Problem

Loading of Kanban is slow in case of many Swimlanes and/or CardColors. 
 See [kanban-board loading is slow|https://confluence.atlassian.com/jirakb/kanban-board-loading-is-slow-performance-problems-800686285.html] for context. 
 This computation is done as part of {{/rest/greenhopper/1.0/xboard/work/allData.json}} API request. 
 +One of the reasons:+ _IssueIdCallback_ is loading the whole Lucene document to extract only _issue_id_.
 +Context:+ This callback is used for swimlanes, card colours and getting ids of visible issues.
h3. Suggestion

It could be rewritten to operate with {{SortedDocValues}}, which should be faster since it doesn't require to load the whole document from the index
h3. Results

Ridiculous dataset:
 * Backlog with 10k issues
 * 11 JQL-based colours
 ** Each color query returns almost all 10k issues

Time to calculate colours:
1,4sec -> 80msec
fields.summary: Kanban board - IssueIdCallback loads documents to get only id

in the Documentation for [Backing up data|https://confluence.atlassian.com/adminjiraserver/backing-up-data-938847673.html] all Jira versions it states:
{quote}
*Note:* For all of the following procedures, you must be logged in as a user with the *Jira Administrators* [global permission|https://confluence.atlassian.com/adminjiraserver/managing-global-permissions-938847142.html].

Change *Jira Administrators* to *Jira System Administrators*

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition
The ability to reopen sprints was added in Jira 7.1, but did not come with an option to toggle this feature on and off. Presently, any user with the *Manage Sprints* permission can reopen a sprint. Please provide a means to restrict this permission further.

h3. Suggested Solution
Either implement a dark feature to disallow reopening of sprints, or create a new project-level permission to explicitly allow/disallow the ability to reopen a sprint.

h3. Why this is important
Users reopening sprints can interrupt schedules and planning.
fields.summary: As an admin, I'd like to restrict users' abilities to reopen sprints

h3. Summary

In JIRA when you have a review that contains over a certain amount of Russian characters (my tests suggest around 309) in the description selecting the {{Create review for all commits}} button in development panel directs the user to a white screen.

In the console we can see that the request has been encoded in some way resulting in an extremely long request resulting in a HTTP 413 Request Entity too large response:

!Screen Shot 2016-04-14 at 09.46.11.png|thumbnail!




h3. Environment
JIRA with an Application link to Crucible - re-produceable in:
Crucible - 3.9.1, 3.8.1
JIRA - 6.4

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Create a JIRA ticket with a description containing a minimum of 309 Russian characters in the Description field
# Attempt to create a review for all of the commits associated with the ticket

h3. Expected Results

Redirected to Crucible where the user continues the creation of the Review

h3. Actual Results

HTTP 413 response and user is directed to a white screen in Crucible - the URL of the screen reads as {{<Crucible_URL>/<path>/cru/create?issueKey=<JIRA_issue_key>&<Crucible_issueKey=>&<issueSummary=>}}

fields.description:
NOTE: This is a SUPPORT REQUEST for BAMBOO (not Jira)... For whatever reason - there's no Bamboo in the Project drop-down list above... (as well as no Support Request in the Issue Type)...

 

I have posted same question to Atlassian Community forum: [https://community.atlassian.com/t5/Bamboo-questions/Repository-stored-Bamboo-Specs-and-POM-XML/qaq-p/914363]

 

6.2 release of Bamboo brought possibility of storing build plan configuration (Bamboo Specs) in Bitbucket repository ([https://confluence.atlassian.com/bamboo/bamboo-6-2-release-notes-938641951.html]). Bamboo documentation describing enabling this feature ([https://confluence.atlassian.com/bamboo/enabling-repository-stored-bamboo-specs-938641941.html]) provides step-by-step instructions on how this can be done, but mentions *nothing* about any additional dependencies or requirements to make it actually work.

 

When our team tested this functionality (by downloading Bamboo specs from existing plans, storing them in Bitbucket repo, and then creating a test project that uses that Linked Repository) - demonstrates that when repo contains nothing but the plans themselves (*.java specs) updates to the repo result in *NO PROCESSING* (Bamboo logs generated in response to repo updates - are *entirely blank*, containing *nothing*).

 

Our subsequent tests demonstrated that *pom.xml* is required to start the build process...

 

So questions are:
 * *IS POM.XML - AN ABSOLUTE REQUIREMENT FOR BUILDING BAMBOO PLANS FROM SPECS?*

... or
 * *is POM.XML required only for LOCAL MAVEN RUNS, and something else needs to be done to enable REPOSITORY-STORED Bamboo spec builds without pom.xml?*

 

P.S.     Our team has paid Bamboo support
fields.summary: Repository-stored Bamboo Specs and role of POM.XML

fields.description:
h3. Summary
REST API call _PUT_ {{/rest/projects/1.0/project/<PRJ>/lastVisited}} is used to track last visited project. 
While executing the call, method started to load the context thus executing {{com.atlassian.greenhopper.web.sidebar.BoardScopeFilterContextProviderImpl#getContext}} which leads to expensive computations (see JSWSERVER-16185).
Due to excessive computation, it puts extra pressure for the permission cache and increases CPU usage, which may lead to degraded performance of the whole Jira instance. 

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Load any issue, Jira will execute _PUT_ {{/rest/projects/1.0/project/<PRJ>/lastVisited}} as part of page loading
# Put a break point and collect stack-trace 

h3. Expected Results
_getContext_ is not executed

h3. Actual Results
_getContext_ is executed

h3. Notes
Taking into account that {{/lastVisited}} is executed for each issue load, this adds extra CPU overhead for Jira.
Snippet from stacktrace:
{noformat}
...
	at com.atlassian.greenhopper.service.query.QueryServiceImpl.getProjectsForRapidView(QueryServiceImpl.java:137)
	at com.atlassian.greenhopper.service.query.QueryServiceImpl.getExplicitProjectsForRapidViewFilterQuery(QueryServiceImpl.java:128)
	at com.atlassian.greenhopper.service.rapid.ProjectRapidViewServiceImpl.findProjectsByRapidView(ProjectRapidViewServiceImpl.java:69)
	at com.atlassian.greenhopper.service.rapid.ProjectRapidViewServiceImpl.findRapidViewsByProject(ProjectRapidViewServiceImpl.java:51)
	at com.atlassian.greenhopper.web.sidebar.ProjectBoardsHelper.getProjectBoards(ProjectBoardsHelper.java:53)
	at com.atlassian.greenhopper.web.sidebar.BoardScopeFilterContextProviderImpl.getContext(BoardScopeFilterContextProviderImpl.java:47)
	at com.atlassian.jira.projects.context.ProjectContextPopulatorImpl.populateWithProject(ProjectContextPopulatorImpl.java:82)
	at com.atlassian.jira.projects.sidebar.navigation.SidebarNavigationService.getNavigationItemById(SidebarNavigationService.java:49)
	at com.atlassian.jira.projects.sidebar.lastvisited.LastVisitedNavigationItemHelper.getNavigationItemById(LastVisitedNavigationItemHelper.java:58)
	at com.atlassian.jira.projects.sidebar.lastvisited.LastVisitedItemInProjectService.isValid(LastVisitedItemInProjectService.java:101)
	at com.atlassian.jira.projects.sidebar.lastvisited.LastVisitedItemInProjectService.setLastVisitedItemIdForProject(LastVisitedItemInProjectService.java:59)
	at com.atlassian.jira.projects.sidebar.lastvisited.LastVisitedItemResource.updateLastVisitedItem(LastVisitedItemResource.java:51)
...
{noformat}
Based on performance data, {{/lastVisited}} calls might be up to 10% of all CPU active threads.

h3.Workaround
Please check JSWSERVER-16717 to be able to disable sidebar loading code.
fields.summary: REST call lastVisited executes board-scope-filter which leads to performance overhead

h3. Summary
Issues that ties to a previous Completed sprint and added to current active sprint does not appear on the Sprint report if the issue is removed from Active Sprint.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Create sprint A
# Put issue 1 in Sprint A
 !ISSUE board - Agile Board - Amirul JIRA 711 - Google Chrome 2018-10-09 10.58.40.png|thumbnail! 
# Start and close sprint A without completing issue 1. Issue 1 will go to the backlog.
# Create sprint B
# Put issue 1 and 2 in sprint B
# Start sprint B
# Remove both issues from sprint B

h3. Expected Results
The Sprint report would show the issue 1 and 2 under "Issues Removed From Sprint"

h3. Actual Results
The sprint report only show issue 2 as removed from Sprint and issue 1 is missing.
 !ISSUE board - Agile Board - Amirul JIRA 711 - Google Chrome 2018-10-09 11.01.58.png|thumbnail! 
 !ISSUE board - Agile Board - Amirul JIRA 711 - Google Chrome 2018-10-09 11.04.05.png|thumbnail! 

h3. Workaround
(!) No known workaround at this time.

h3. Note
Affecting issues that contain a previous Completed sprint.

	at com.atlassian.web.servlet.plugin.request.RedirectInterceptingFilter.doFilter(RedirectInterceptingFilter.java:21)
	... 53 filtered
	at com.atlassian.jira.security.JiraSecurityFilter.lambda$doFilter$0(JiraSecurityFilter.java:66)
	... 1 filtered
	at com.atlassian.jira.security.JiraSecurityFilter.doFilter(JiraSecurityFilter.java:64)
	... 16 filtered
	at com.atlassian.plugins.rest.module.servlet.RestSeraphFilter.doFilter(RestSeraphFilter.java:37)
	... 19 filtered
	at com.atlassian.jira.servermetrics.CorrelationIdPopulatorFilter.doFilter(CorrelationIdPopulatorFilter.java:30)
	... 5 filtered
	at com.atlassian.jwt.internal.servlet.JwtAuthFilter.doFilter(JwtAuthFilter.java:32)
	... 8 filtered
	at com.atlassian.web.servlet.plugin.request.RedirectInterceptingFilter.doFilter(RedirectInterceptingFilter.java:21)
	... 4 filtered
	at com.atlassian.web.servlet.plugin.LocationCleanerFilter.doFilter(LocationCleanerFilter.java:36)
	... 26 filtered
	at com.atlassian.jira.servermetrics.MetricsCollectorFilter.doFilter(MetricsCollectorFilter.java:25)
	... 23 filtered
	at java.util.concurrent.ThreadPoolExecutor.runWorker(ThreadPoolExecutor.java:1149)
	at java.util.concurrent.ThreadPoolExecutor$Worker.run(ThreadPoolExecutor.java:624)
	at org.apache.tomcat.util.threads.TaskThread$WrappingRunnable.run(TaskThread.java:61)
	at java.lang.Thread.run(Thread.java:748)
{code}

The Following Exception is caught in the Javascript console of the Browser developer tools:
{code}
Uncaught TypeError: Cannot read property 'balancingSuspended' of undefined
    at Object.GH.tpl.lexorankmanagement.renderBalanceStatus (com.pyxis.greenhopper.jira:gh-admin-lexorank-manage-app.js:24)
    at child.render (com.pyxis.greenhopper.jira:gh-admin-lexorank-manage-app.js:325)
    at triggerEvents (batch.js:47978)
    at child.trigger (batch.js:47918)
    at child.set (batch.js:48132)
    at Object.<anonymous> (com.pyxis.greenhopper.jira:gh-admin-lexorank-manage-app.js:164)
    at fire (batch.js:2824)
    at Object.fireWith (batch.js:2942)
    at Object.fire (batch.js:2949)
    at fire (batch.js:2824)

plugin-icon:1 Failed to load resource: the server responded with a status of 404 ()
{code}
 
h3. Notes
Triggering a rebalance from the API *{{POST /rest/greenhopper/1.0/lexorank/balance}}* will fail on balance interrupted error.

The Following Select will identify rank values in the bad state:
{code}
SELECT * FROM "AO_60DB71_LEXORANK" left join jiraissue j on j.id = "AO_60DB71_LEXORANK"."ISSUE_ID" where j.id is NULL and "FIELD_ID" = <Lexorank_Field>;
{code}

h3.Workaround

(flag) Please take AO_60DB71_LEXORANK table back up before performing delete operation
(flag) Please adjust your FIELD_ID value per your environment that corresponds to RANK custom field.
(flag) Make the note of limit clause we are using to determine which rank from the top has proper issue_id associated.
(flag) Queries below are Postgres complaint. Please tweak it according to DB being used.

Notice the stack trace above, we are trying to get the max rank and then issue key from issue that we retrieved as having max rank from AO_60DB71_LEXORANK table. Below is the translated query used behind the scene to fetch that info:

{code:java}
select "LEXORANK"."FIELD_ID", "LEXORANK"."ID", "LEXORANK"."ISSUE_ID", "LEXORANK"."RANK", "LEXORANK"."TYPE", "LEXORANK"."BUCKET" from "AO_60DB71_LEXORANK" "LEXORANK"  where "LEXORANK"."FIELD_ID" = <your_Rank_FIELD_ID> and "LEXORANK"."TYPE" = 1 order by length("LEXORANK"."RANK") desc, "LEXORANK"."RANK" desc limit 1
{code}

Run following query to figure if the issue_id we retrieved from above is present in the jiraissue table or not

{code:java}
select * from jiraissue j2 where j2.id in (select adl."ISSUE_ID" from "AO_60DB71_LEXORANK" adl where 
adl."FIELD_ID"=<your_Rank_FIELD_ID> and adl."TYPE"=1 order by length(adl."RANK") desc, adl."RANK" desc limit 1)
{code}

With stack failure like above we can only get NPE if the issue_id retrieved from first query is not present in jiraissue table and hence we could not form issue object to get the issue key from. We need to keep increasing the limit in first query and correspondingly in the second query or just in the second query itself to determine which one of these descending max rank does have a valid issue_id associated(the one that exist in the jira issue table).
 
Let's say we got 13th record from the top that gave us the issue_id which exist in the jira issue table, this determines the fact that earlier 12 records were stale and is not needed. In other words you got result for this query, while you kept on increasing the limit each time:

{code:java}
select * from jiraissue j2 where j2.id in (select adl."ISSUE_ID" from "AO_60DB71_LEXORANK" adl where 
adl."FIELD_ID"=<your_Rank_FIELD_ID> and adl."TYPE"=1 order by length(adl."RANK") desc, adl."RANK" desc limit 13)
{code}

We need to clean up records from AO_60DB71_LEXORANK table where ISSUE_ID is not in jiraissue table(in our example it is 12 such rows from top that we need to clean up). Since we have the table back up, it is safe to run below query to clean up the records:

- Stop the Servers.
- Run the delete command 
{code:java}
delete from "AO_60DB71_LEXORANK" "lr" where "lr"."ID" in ( select "LEXORANK"."ID" from "AO_60DB71_LEXORANK" "LEXORANK"
where "LEXORANK"."FIELD_ID" = <your_Rank_FIELD_ID> and "LEXORANK"."TYPE" = 1 order by length("LEXORANK"."RANK") desc, "LEXORANK"."RANK" desc limit 12)
{code}
// *NOTE*: limit 12 is just an example here. We need to determine specifically for each environment facing this issue, what that value would be, using the second join query. Every time we do not get the result we keep increasing the limit.
- Start the servers and try access the lexorank management page. The balancing section(that internally makes a call to /rest/greenhopper/1.0/lexorank/balance) should be showing up on the page.
fields.summary: Lexorank management does not display table data and Rebalance is not visible

fields.description:
Use case:  We have 100's of teams that we want all to use a "common" set of schemes.  As part of this, we want them to use a common base set of fields (thru common screens and a single common field configuration).  But, we also have some teams that need some "extra" fields.

We would like the ability to add these "extra" fields to the screens, but by default have them hidden by the field configuration (I will call them "optionally shown").  Then we would like, on a project by project basis, for each project admin to be able to "unhide" these fields as needed for their project.  This would allow teams to have a common set of fields, but be able to choose from another set of fields ("optionally-shown") ala-cart, w/o having to create a field configuration for each project.  So each project gets a fixed set of fields and can then also add fields from a "menu" of other fields.

fields.description:
h3. Summary

_Sprint Burndown gadget_ does not load any data on the dashboard.
 Sometimes it's possible to make it load, but it's intermittent and doesn't seems to have anything else related.

It could be caused by the chromium [bug|https://bugs.chromium.org/p/chromium/issues/detail?id=108055]. What causes some of the requests could not be performed by the web browser. It is because of insufficient resources.
h3. Environment
 * JIRA 7.11.0

h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Add couple(6 or more) _Sprint Burndown gadget_ to the dashboard,
 # In gadget's configuration, select the board with the current active Sprint and _refresh interval_ is 15 minutes, Save,
 # Enable developer console 
 # Refresh the page

Expected Results

The gadget should load the data
h3. Actual Results

The gadget does not load any data (blank)
 !Burndown gadget.png|thumbnail!

In the console log and developer tools you can find this error:
{code:java}
net::ERR_INSUFFICIENT_RESOURCES{code}
  !image-2020-03-24-10-36-36-110.png|thumbnail!
h3. Workaround
 # If you are the owner of the Dashboard: Click _Edit -> Cancel_ on the gadget configuration.
 # If you are not, you can either:
 -- Copy that dashboard and then click _Edit -> Cancel_ button Or
 -- Ask the owner of the board to change the _Refresh Interval_ of the gadget to _15 minutes_, the data will be loaded after 15 minutes.
 # Decrease the number of gadgets on the board,
 # Switch to another web browser like Firefox

*Notes:*
 This happens mainly on Google Chrome, also verified in Safari and IE.
 (!) Note that the issue has also been observed on Firefox by customers, so switching to Firefox is not guaranteed to resolve the issue.
fields.summary: Sprint burn down gadget doesn't display any data

fields.description:
h3. Summary
When a parent issue has Sub tasks that are excluded in the board filter, and all child sub task issues that are present in the board filter are complete you are prompted with the popup to transition parent issue to the done status, however when selecting Update the popup is continuously triggered.  

This Scenario occurs is when you have multiple boards for the various subtask issue-types that are to be completed at different times, I.E. Kanban Boards with subtasks split up between various teams

h3. Steps to Reproduce
* Kanban board 1 with filter
{code}
project = projectA and issuetype in (standard_issuetype1, subtask_issuetype1)  ORDER BY Rank ASC
{code}
* Kanban Board 1 with filter:
{code}
project = projectA and issuetype in (standard_issuetype1, subtask_issuetype2)  ORDER BY Rank ASC
{code}
* Create 1 sub tasks of each type under the same parrent
* Complete the Sub Task in Board 1

h3. Expected Results
Action is completed popup is not re-triggered

h3. Actual Results
Transition parent issue popup reoccurs
 
h3. Notes
The Parent issue is moved to the done status and completed But the popup will continue to reoccur until you select cancel, each time you select update it will enter a new issue history event

h3.Workaround
To be able to work through the sub tasks without completing the parent set up a condition as covered in the following KB article:
- [Preventing issues from being closed while the sub-tasks are still open | https://confluence.atlassian.com/jirakb/preventing-issues-from-being-closed-while-the-sub-tasks-are-still-open-724928276.html]
fields.summary: Popup loop when Parent issue still has incomplete Sub-tasks

fields.description:
h3. Summary
"Looking for an older issue?" link on kanban board does not work on IE11

h3. Environment
* JIRA Software 7.11.1
* IE11

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Open a kanban board
# In the "Done" column click on "Looking for an older issue?"

h3. Expected Results
* Link is opened successfully

h3. Actual Results
* IE11 runs into HTTP 400 Bad Request error
 
h3. Workaround
* N/A, use other browsers

h3. Note
The request fails due to the "Looking for an older issue?" link being unencoded, ie:
{code}issues/?jql=project = "ABC" AND status = "In Progress"{code}
Other browsers seems to be able to encode the URL on their own which changes it to below and request goes through successfully:
{code}/issues/?jql=project%20%3D%20"ABC"%20AND%20status%20%3D%20"In%20Progress"{code}

However, this link works fine for IE11 on JIRA Software 7.9. The browser is redirected to an encoded URL after clicking on the link.
fields.summary: "Looking for an older issue?" link does not work on IE11

h3. *+Problem+*
Time Tracking in Smart Commits does not record all logged time with multiple commits in a single push.

h3. *+Steps to reproduce+*
# Create a new text file, test.txt.
# Execute below git command, 1st push with 10 minutes logged time.
{code}
git add test.txt
git commit -m "KEY-1 #time 10m 1st in push"
{code}
# Update the test.txt file again, execute below git command (2nd push with 20 minutes logged time).
{code}
git add test.txt
git commit -m "KEY-1 #time 20m 2nd in push"

git push
{code}

h3. *+Expected Results+*
The logged time should be reflected as 30 minutes in total.

h3. *+Actual Results+*
2 worklogs are added, but the total time spent (Logged) only take either 10m or 20m.
 !screenshot-1.png|thumbnail!

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
REST API request */rest/ical/1.0/ical/config/query/options* is taking a long time to return the full set of data that cause the JIRA event creation on Confluence team calendar fails with the timeout error. 

h3. Environment
Large Jira instance with
* 2000+ projects, or
* 30000+ search filters

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Configure 2000 projects and 30,000 filters in Jira
# Go to Confluence, create a Calendar event that pulls in Jira projects

h3. Expected Results
Correctly allow the user to choose the Jira project and proceed without error.

h3. Actual Results
The below exception is thrown in the atlassian-confluence.log file:
{noformat}
2019-07-24 04:37:44,960 ERROR [http-nio-8080-exec-1] [calendar3.rest.ExceptionMappers.GeneralExceptionMapper] getResponseError General exception happen on calendar resources
 -- referer: https://confluence/display/ZTEST/calendar/xxxxxxx-9b64-44c5-8a93-810942e14566?calendarName=Release%20Calendar | url: /rest/calendar-services/1.0/calendar/jira/xxxxxxx-cefa-3cdd-9508-4a4945627d9a/query/options.json | userName: admin
com.atlassian.sal.api.net.ResponseException: java.net.SocketTimeoutException: Read timed out
{noformat}

access_log of Jira show:
{noformat}
10.0.0.111 252x3288526x4 admin [15/Aug/2019:04:17:18 +0000] http-nio-8080-exec-1 admin "GET /rest/ical/1.0/ical/config/query/options?_=1111111111&xoauth_requestor_id=admin HTTP/1.1" 200 511689 293768 "-" "Apache-HttpClient/4.5.5 (Java/1.8.0)" "xxxxx"
{noformat}
(i) 293768 = 4 minutes 54 seconds
 
h3. Notes
*/rest/ical/1.0/ical/config/query/options* contains the following data
* List of projects
* List of Search filters
* Names of viewable fields

h3. Workaround
Increase the timeout for the calendar connection as mentioned in the KB article [JIRA Calendar Read Timed Out|https://confluence.atlassian.com/confkb/jira-calendar-read-timed-out-312740464.html].
fields.summary: Slow /rest/ical/1.0/ical/config/query/options times out for Team Calendar

fields.description:
When using a linked repository from Bitbucket, if you commit 2 files with time tracking, only one will be tracked in the dev panel. The worklog tab will remain unaffected
h2. Steps to reproduce
 # Have a linked Bitbucket and Jira Software instance
 # Create a project called Jira and an issue JIRA-1 
 # In the local Bitbucket repository touch file1.txt
 # git add . 
 # git commit -m "JIRA-1 #time 5m"
 # touch file2.txt
 # git add .
 # git commit -m "JIRA-1 #time 10m"
 # git push

h2. Expected Results

15 minutes show up on the dev panel Work Logged.
h2. Actual Results

5 or 10 minutes show up on the dev panel Work Logged. The Work log tab where the comments reside will show both commits coming in with the 5 and 10 minutes logged separately.

 
h2. Workaround

No known workaround.
fields.summary: Pushing two commits at once with time tracking breaks dev panel

fields.description:
*+Summary+*
Service desk fields – including Customer Request Type & SLAs – do not show on Kanban boards or the Active Sprint view in Scrum boards. 

*+Steps to Reproduce+*
# Create a service desk project and some service desk issues.
# Ensure that the Request Type has a value.
# Create a Kanban board using the option "Existing Project..."
# Configure board > Card Layout > Select a Service Desk field, e.g. "Customer Request Type".
# Go back to board to verify if the field is displayed on board.

*+Expected Results+*
The field "Customer Request Type" should show on board. {color:#DE350B}Note: Below screenshot taken from JSW 7.10.2 where it is working.{color}
 !screenshot-3.png|thumbnail!

*+Actual Results+*
The field "Customer Request Type' is not showing on board.
 !screenshot-4.png|thumbnail! 

*+Additional information+*
This is reproducible on JSW 7.11.x, JSW 7.12.x and looks like a regression as it is working on JSW 7.10.2. Service desk fields *do* render in the Backlog view of a Scrum board.
fields.summary: Service Desk fields do not show on agile boards

project.name: Jira Software Server and Data Center

fields.description:
There is a Created vs. Resolved gadget available in Jira which allows you to plot created tickets and resolved tickets for a saved filter. 

The gap in this gadget vs. our requirement is that we need to track created vs. implemented/rejected. The use model across DM and the DM reporters (DE users) is to mark tickets implemented when fixed. Users do not regularly mark tickets closed. So, the existing filter reports implemented tickets as "unresolved". 

We also want to track cumulative backlog in the same gadget. In summary, the requirement is a gadget that can be provided by Atlassian as a default OOB gadget :
* Tracks created issues on a "SOC program"  (custom field) per custom JQL 
* Tracks implemented/rejected issues on a SOC program(custom field) per custom JQL 
* Tracks backlog of open issues (defined as status in Analyzed, Assessed, Open, Opened) based on custom JQL
fields.summary: Enhance JIRA Gadget to use custom fields with Date/Time type to show charting in the Dashboard

fields.description:
h3. Summary

Clicking on *Looking for an older issue?* link in Internet Explorer will result in error 400 broken link.

+Steps to reproduce+

# Create a Kanban board.
# Access JIRA with Internet Explorer 11.
# Access the newly created Kanban board.
# From the board section of the Kanban board, click on "Looking for an older issue?" and "HTTP 400 bad request" will be shown.


h3. Environment

JIRA 7.11.0 & 7.11.2
Internet Explorer 11


h3. Expected Results

JIRA shows older issues from the Kanban board.


h3. Actual Results

Internet Explorer shows "HTTP 400 bad request" error.


h3.Workaround

# Use other browser such as Google Chrome.
# Manually edit the URL from something like:

{code}
http://10.60.2.128:8710/vicky//issues/?jql=project = SKP AND issuetype != "10100" AND (fixVersion in unreleasedVersions() OR fixVersion is EMPTY) AND status = "10001" AND NOT (updated >= -2w OR statusCategory != Done) ORDER BY Rank ASC
{code}

to 

{code}
http://10.60.2.128:8710/vicky/issues/?jql=project%20%3D%20SKP%20AND%20issuetype%20!%3D%20%2210100%22%20AND%20(fixVersion%20in%20unreleasedVersions()%20OR%20fixVersion%20is%20EMPTY)%20AND%20status%20%3D%20%2210001%22%20AND%20NOT%20(updated%20%3E%3D%20-2w%20OR%20statusCategory%20!%3D%20Done)%20ORDER%20BY%20Rank%20ASC
{code}
fields.summary: "Looking for an older issue?" broken in Internet Explorer
